content.text:
<task>
i'd like to use you to draft a commit message but i'm not sure how. the git diff | cat output is too large. Could you run git diff | wc -l to see how many lines it is, and then output only a subset of the output, and begin a commit draft based on that subset, labeling it with how many lines you processed and how to continue with the next chunk?
</task>

diff --git a/include/shap/coord.hpp b/include/shap/coord.hpp
index a80a3ac..0297d3c 100644
--- a/include/shap/coord.hpp
+++ b/include/shap/coord.hpp
@@ -549 +5410 @@ public:
      * Construct from individual components.
      */
     template<typename... Args>
-    explicit Coord(Args... args) noexcept
+    explicit Coord(Args... args)
         : coords_{static_cast<double>(args)...} {
         static_assert(sizeof...(Args) == N "Must provide exactly N components");
+        validate();
     }

     // Component access
@@ -686 +6923 @@ public:
     [[nodiscard]] double y() const noexcept requires std::is_same_v<SpaceTag WorldSpaceTag> { return coords_[1]; }
     [[nodiscard]] double z() const noexcept requires (std::is_same_v<SpaceTag WorldSpaceTag> && N == 3) { return coords_[2]; }

+    // Validate coordinates based on space type
+    void validate() const {
+        if constexpr (std::is_same_v<SpaceTag ParamSpaceTag>) {
+            for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) {
+                if (coords_[i] < 0.0 || coords_[i] > 1.0) {
+                    throw std::invalid_argument("Parameter space coordinates must be in [01]");
+                }
+            }
+        }
+    }
+
+    // Explicit conversion to double for 1D coordinates
+    explicit operator double() const requires (N == 1 && std::is_same_v<CoordTag PointTag>) {
+        validate();
+        return coords_[0];
+    }
+
     // Parameter space accessors
     [[nodiscard]] double u() const noexcept requires std::is_same_v<SpaceTag ParamSpaceTag> { return coords_[0]; }
     [[nodiscard]] double v() const noexcept requires std::is_same_v<SpaceTag ParamSpaceTag> { return coords_[1]; }
@@ -1096 +12713 @@ public:
         return result;
     }

+    ThisType& operator*=(double scale) noexcept {
+        for (int i = 0; i < N; ++i) {
+            coords_[i] *= scale;
+        }
+        return *this;
+    }
+
     // Vector operations (available for vectors only)
     template<typename T = CoordTag>
     [[nodiscard]] double length_squared() const noexcept requires std::is_same_v<T VectorTag> {
@@ -2204 +24537 @@ using WorldVector3 = Coord<3 VectorTag WorldSpaceTag>;
 using ParamPoint3 = Coord<3 PointTag ParamSpaceTag>;
 using ParamVector3 = Coord<3 VectorTag ParamSpaceTag>;

+// Comparison operators for 1D parameter points
+template<int N typename SpaceTag>
+bool operator<(
+    const Coord<N PointTag SpaceTag>& a
+    const Coord<N PointTag SpaceTag>& b
+) noexcept requires (N == 1) {
+    return static_cast<double>(a) < static_cast<double>(b);
+}
+
+template<int N typename SpaceTag>
+bool operator<=(
+    const Coord<N PointTag SpaceTag>& a
+    const Coord<N PointTag SpaceTag>& b
+) noexcept requires (N == 1) {
+    return static_cast<double>(a) <= static_cast<double>(b);
+}
+
+template<int N typename SpaceTag>
+bool operator>(
+    const Coord<N PointTag SpaceTag>& a
+    const Coord<N PointTag SpaceTag>& b
+) noexcept requires (N == 1) {
+    return static_cast<double>(a) > static_cast<double>(b);
+}
+
+template<int N typename SpaceTag>
+bool operator>=(
+    const Coord<N PointTag SpaceTag>& a
+    const Coord<N PointTag SpaceTag>& b
+) noexcept requires (N == 1) {
+    return static_cast<double>(a) >= static_cast<double>(b);
+}
+
 } // namespace shap

<content>DRAFT COMMIT MESSAGE (Processing 500/3029 lines):

feat(coord): Add parameter space validation and 1D coordinate operations

- Add runtime validation for parameter space coordinates
- Add explicit conversion operator to double for 1D coordinates
- Add *= operator for coordinate scaling
- Add comparison operators for 1D parameter points

DRAFT COMMIT MESSAGE (Processing 1000/3029 lines):

refactor: Improve geometric primitives and path handling

Core Changes:
- Add runtime validation for parameter space coordinates
- Add explicit conversion operator to double for 1D coordinates
- Add *= operator for coordinate scaling
- Add comparison operators for 1D parameter points

Geometric Point Improvements:
- Replace raw derivatives array with FrameVectors class
- Add RiemannianMetric computation
- Add surface-specific edge detection functionality
- Add pushforward/pullback transformations

Path System Refactoring:
- Convert SurfacePath to use std::function for evaluation
- Refactor path classes to use ParamPoint types consistently
- Improve shared_ptr usage with enable_shared_from_this
- Add nearest point functionality to manifolds
- Streamline path segment and transition path implementations

Development:
- Update development guidelines in .clinerules
- Enforce const correctness in surface pointers
- Use std::bind for function binding instead of lambdas

Note: This is a partial commit message. More changes to be analyzed (2029 lines remaining).
